org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.slip

Interface SlipBridgeCommunicationProtocol

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BridgeCommunicationProtocol
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SCgetDeviceStatus, SCgetFirmware, SCgetHouseStatus, SCgetLANConfig, SCgetLimitation, SCgetProduct, SCgetProducts, SCgetScenes, SCgetWLANConfig, SClogin, SClogout, SCrunProductCommand, SCrunProductDiscovery, SCrunProductIdentification, SCrunProductSearch, SCrunScene, SCsetHouseStatusMonitor, SCsetLimitation, SCsetSceneVelocity

    @NonNullByDefault
interface SlipBridgeCommunicationProtocol
extends BridgeCommunicationProtocol
    Protocol specific bridge communication supported by the Velux bridge: Authentication

    Common Message semantic: Communication with the bridge and (optionally) storing returned information within the class itself.

    As 2nd level interface it defines the methods to help in sending a query and processing the received answer.

    (Additional) Methods in this interface for the appropriate interaction:

    • getRequestCommand to return the intended command to be sent.
    • getRequestDataAsArrayOfBytes to return the intended data part to be sent.
    • setResponse to store the response already separated into response command and data part.
    • isCommunicationFinished to signal the completeness of the interaction (only available after storing the response).

    Other mandatory methods are inherited from BridgeCommunicationProtocol.

    Author:
    Guenther Schreiner - Initial contribution.

        static final byte[] EMPTYDATA

    • Method Detail

      • getRequestCommand

        VeluxKLFAPI.CommandNumber getRequestCommand()
        Returning the command part of the request object for further SLIP serialization.
        Returns:
        commandNumber is of type VeluxKLFAPI.CommandNumber.

      • getRequestDataAsArrayOfBytes

        byte[] getRequestDataAsArrayOfBytes()
        Returning the data part of the request object for further SLIP serialization.
        Returns:
        dataAsArrayOfBytes is an Array of byte.

      • setResponse

        void setResponse(short thisResponseCommand,
                 byte[] thisResponseData,
                 boolean isSequentialEnforced)
        Storing the command and the data part of the response object for further checks.
        Parameters:
        thisResponseCommand - of type short: command part of the response packet.
        thisResponseData - of type Array of bytes: data part of response packet to be processed.
        isSequentialEnforced - of type boolean: enforces the strict handshake sequence even for long duration interactions.

      • isCommunicationFinished

        boolean isCommunicationFinished()
        Returning the communication status included within the response message..
        Returns:
        isFinished is a boolean signaling the end of this transaction.
